title: Will Smith, Eddie Murphy, Wesley Snipes and Martin Lawrence in one photo
text:
Legends (Picture: Martin Lawrence, Instagram)

Four Hollywood icons came together for a rare photo opportunity this week, with Will Smith, Eddie Murphy, Martin Lawrence and Wesley Snipes all pictured together for the first time in years – if not ever.

The screen greats came together at Tyler Perry’s new movie studios in Atlanta, Georgia on Tuesday and, of course, when you have that many legends in the same room, it would be wrong not to capture the special moment.

Will, 50, first shared the epic photo on his Instagram account with the tongue-in-cheek caption: ‘Nothing to see here….’

His Bad Boys sidekick Martin added: ‘When Bad Boys come to America. #teammartymar#badboys #comingtoamerica#makinghistory #friends.’

It’s possible the meeting simply happened by chance as Will and Martin are likely putting the finishing touches to Bad Boys: For Life, while Eddie and Wesley are both starring in the anticipated Coming 2 America.

Coincidence they’re both sequels?

The photos sent fans into a spin with many calling for one major movie starring all four acting legends.

One even came up with a script, commenting: ‘Beverly Hills Cop, Bad Boys, Passenger 57, Coming To America, Life, Blade, I Am Legend, Trading Places, Independence Day, Demolition Man, Gemini Man, Dolemite Is My Name, Blue Streak, the list of classic films standing in this photo are timeless and too many to name!!

‘Now if we can just get all four Legends in a major Blockbuster together, Im thinking Action Spy genre with comedic elements.

‘With all four leads having equal Bond-esque capabilities working as a team in the cinematic viegn of a mission impossible-esque film, major budget, Universal locations, with each main character trained as an elite secret service operative forming an elite Top Secret Special Forces Unit. All I need is my espresso and my lap top and I can have that script ready in less than 24hr. [sic].’

Someone get that person a scriptwriting job, pronto.

The Coming To America sequel was finally announced this summer and will see Eddie, 58, reprise his role as Akeem, while Arsenio Hall, Wesley and James Earl Jones are also set to star.

Meanwhile the Bad Boys: For Life trailer arrived last week and basically, it looks fire.

Bad Boys: For Life arrives in cinemas on 17 January 2020, while Coming 2 America has a scheduled release date of 18 December 2020.
